hebrew.text: More people die from overeating than from undernourishment.
Do not confine your children to your own learning, for they were born in another time.
Ambition destroys its possessor.
A cow, A cow.
After death, say holy.
Better be a tail for the lions than the head of the foxes.
A basic rule of caution: don't be overly cautious.
A beautiful ornament looks best on a beautiful woman.
A book gives knowledge, but it is life that gives understanding.
A borrower may not lend the thing he borrowed.
A change of name or place may sometimes save a person.
A dog can't be a butcher, and a bachelor can't be a matchmaker.
A dream which has not been interpreted is like a letter unread.
A drunkard at prayer is regarded as an idol worshipper.
A guest who comes empty handed does not deserve a warm welcome.
A henpecked husband gets no support during a lawsuit.
A person can understand things deeply through proverbs.
A person is always responsible: if his act was accidental or intentional, whether he was awake or asleep.
A person slow to anger has great understanding; one with a quick temper exalts foolishness.
A person worries about the past, is upset about the present, and fears the future.
A pointed proverb is like a diamond: it emits light, and it also cuts.
A quotation at the right moment is like bread to the hungry.
A rich man has no need of character.
A secret is between two; when a third is involved, it's no secret.
A slanderer kills three: himself, his listener, and the person who was slandered.
A slave shows his true character, not while he is enslaved but when he becomes a master.
An accuser may not act as a defender.
An advantage of poverty, your relatives gain nothing by your death.
An advantage of poverty: your relatives gain nothing by your death.
An old man in the house is a burden, but an old woman is a treasure.
An unlucky man falls on straw, but splits his nose from a hidden stone.
Anger in a house is like a worm in a plant.
Anxiety breaks a man's backbone.
Approach the perfumer and thou wilt be perfumed.
Ask someone else for advice but keep your knowledge to yourself.
Be careful not to make a woman weep.
Being hospitable is more important than attending synagogue service early in the morning.
Better a night full of anger than a night full of repentance.
Better be a cursed man than he who curses.
Better blind of eye than blind of heart.
Beware of him who gives you advice according to his own interests.
Books provide knowledge, life furnishes understanding.
Breasts adorn a woman and make a man look ugly.
Buttered bread always falls dry side up.
By the first glass a lamb, the second a lion, and the third a pig.
A stupidly devout man, the slyly evil, and the sanctimonious woman - these will destroy the world.
A visit is like rainwater; you pray for it when it stays away and its a problem when it rains too much.
A wedding is like a funeral, but with musicians.
A wise son makes his father happy; a foolish one grieves his mother.
A woman prefers poverty with love to wealth without love.
A young tree bends, an old tree breaks.
Adam was the luckiest of men: he had no mother-in-law.
Admission by the defendant is worth a hundred witnesses.
All jews are responsible, one for another.
All kinds of hellish devils rule an angry person.
God did not create woman from man's head, that he should command her, nor from his feet, that she should be his slave, but rather from his side, that she should be near his heart.
God made man upright, but man searched out many crooked devices.
Good company will save you from bad deeds.
Gossip is more horrible than a capital crime.
Grapes picked too early don't even make good vinegar.
Happy the generation where the great listen to the small, for it follows that in such a generation the small will listen to the great.
He has sold the sun to buy a candle.
He is great whose faults can be numbered.
He that eats till he is sick must fast till he is well.
He who does not teach his son a trade teaches him to steal.
If the dog barks, go in; if the bitch barks you had better stay outside.
If the wine comes in, good sense goes out.
If two men claim your help, and one is your enemy, help him first.
If you add to the truth, you take something away from it.
If you always fear misfortune, you'll miss out on happiness.
If you are born an ass, you will die one.
If you can't find peace within you, you'll labor in vain to find it elsewhere.
If you commence a good action, leave it not incomplete.
If you do a person a favor, you'll be his superior; if he does one for you, his inferior; and if neither, you'll be his friend.
If you do not honor your parents, your children will not honor you.
Money purifies everything.
More than the jewish people preserved the sabbath, the sabbath preserved them.
My fathers planted for me, and I planted for my children.
My friend tells me of my virtue. my enemy notes my fault.
Night was created so that we might consider what we did during the day.
No joy without wine.
No marriage contract is made without a quarrel.
No one is so poor as an ignorant person.
No proverb is untrue.
Poverty is no disgrace, but neither do you have to take pride in it.
Poverty runs after the poor, wealth after the rich.
Pride is the mask we make of our faults.
Promise little and do a lot.
Promise little and do much.
Put another way, satan is a person's wish to do evil.
Real success is success of the soul.
Repentance prolongs a man's life.
Respect flies away for the one who pursues it and hunts the person who is fleeing from it.
Rivalry of scholars advances wisdom.
You recognize the truth by its own sound.
Your friend has a friend and the friend of your friend has another friend. Learn how to keep quiet.
Your health comes first -- you can always hang yourself later.
Make not thy tail broader than thy wings.
Man has succeeded in overcoming tremendous spaces, but not the distance between one man and another.
Man is like a bird: a bird can fly higher and higher, but only if its wings continue to move without stopping.
Man is like a breath, his days like a passing shadow.
Man was born for love. if he hates, he was born in vain.
Many hands can shatter stout walls.
Marry for money, my little sonny, a rich man's joke is always funny.
Marrying off a daughter is like loading cargo on a ship.
Men like guests more than women do.
Men were born with bread in their hands women were born with empty hands.
If you don't aspire to great things, you won't attain small things.
If you don't walk after eating, your food remains undigested.
If you receive pay, you cannot sit idle and if you sit idle, you cannot receive pay.
If you see your friend's ox or sheep straying, don't look the other way; return them to your friend.
If you want to control your soul, hand it as a gift to your intellect.
If your son-in-law is good, you gained a son. if he is bad, you've lost a daughter.
Immortality is surely a pleasant feeling, especially when the individual is still alive.
In a community, your reputation matters. in a strange place, your clothing counts.
In my life of vanity i saw everything: a righteous man dying in his righteousness, and a wicked man living long after his evil deeds.
It cannot be true religion if it loves money.
How great man would be were he not so arrogant.
Humor is an important asset: it means understanding and self-criticism. where humor is absent, you'll find small-mindedness.
I learned much from my teachers, more from my friends, and the most from my pupils.
I was young, now i'm old, and i did not see a righteous man forsaken and his children begging for bread.
If a man and his wife are deserving, god's presence is with them; if they are not deserving, fire consumes them.
If a word be worth one shekel, silence is worth two.
If everyone cleaned his own doorstep, all the streets would be clean.
If i am not for myself, who will be? but if i am only for myself, what am i? and if not now, then when?
If lending were a good idea, then the husband would lend out his wife.
If someone is coming to kill you, get up early and kill him first.
Who seeks more than he needs hinders himself from enjoying what he has.
Who's a hero? he who turns his enemy into his friend.
Whoever can protest against a wrong, and does not, will be punished.
Whoever cannot lie cannot be a matchmaker.
Whoever depends on his wife's earnings will not succeed.
Whoever has not tasted sinfulness does not qualify for holiness.
Whoever hastens to grow rich will not go unpunished.
Whoever hates a reprimand is stupid.
Whoever marries for money will have unworthy children.
Whoever prays loudly, it shows he has little faith.
Of what use is a torch at midday?
Old wine is good for the stomach.
One man differs from another in three things: his voice, his appearance, and his mind.
One person's candle furnishes light for many.
Opinions founded on prejudice are always sustained with the greatest violence.
Partnership is good only with your wife - and there are those who say this too is not certain.
People hate what they do not understand.
People worry, and God smiles.
Physician, heal thyself.
Poverty is a wonderful thing. It sticks to a man after all his friends have forsaken him.
The gambler breaks all of the ten commandments.
The greatest and rarest talent is to love everything good.
The greatest charity is to enable the poor to earn a living.
The greatest wisdom of all is kindness.
The heart sees better than the eye.
The hearts of fools are in their mouths but the mouths of the wise are in their hearts.
The kind man feeds his cat before sitting down to dinner.
The loftier and more distant the ideal, the greater its power to lift up the soul.
The milk of black goats and white goats is all the same.
The more money, the happier; the more wit, the happier.
Tradition must be a springboard to the future, not an easy chair for resting.
Tread on thorns with your shoes on.
Two coins in a purse make more noise than a hundred.
Two dogs can kill a lion.
Two farmers each claimed to own a certain cow. While one pulled on its head and the other pulled on its tail, the cow was milked by the lawyer.
Until a child is one year old it is incapable of sin.
Until your fortieth it is better to eat than to drink; afterwards it is vice versa.
Untying one of two ropes tied together means you untie both.
Verbal fraud is worse than monetary fraud.
Vinegar is the son of wine.
Virtue bears its own fruits.
Walls have ears.
We must not appoint a leader over the community without first consulting the people.
We should bolster the light rather than fight the darkness.
Weep for the mourners, not for the dead; they have gone to their rest, and we are left to lament.
When a bribe enters through the front door, honesty departs through the window.
When a divorced man marries a divorced woman, there are four people in that marital bed.
When a life is at stake, don't follow the majority.
When prices drop, buy.
When swindlers meet a genuinely honest man, they're so astonished they regard him as a greater swindler than themselves.
Faith is not a whole series of axioms but a whole way of life.
Fire dies for lack of wood; if there's no whispering, gossip stops.
Flee from sin as from a snake; if you go near it, it will bite you.
From a limb that started sinning, all the troubles began.
Gamblers do not contribute to the public welfare.
Give me good advice but don't advise me not to do it.
Gluttony has killed more people than famine has.
God could not be everywhere, that's why he made mothers.
God counts her tears.
God detests a man who rushes to accuse a neighbor.
The voice of the people is like the voice of the almighty.
The well that is most often used gives the purest water.
The wise man's nakedness is between his loins, and that of the fool between his cheeks.
The world exists on three things: truth, justice, and peace.
The world is a tavern and the way hereafter is our home.
The world is in the hands of fools.
The world is sustained by three things: justice, truth and peace.
The world rests on three things: the bible, religious worship, and deeds of loving kindness.
The world's like a ladder: one ascends, and one descends.
The worst kind of person is one whose power of speech is greater than his power of thought.
Talking is silver, silence is golden.
Teach thy tongue to say, "I do not know."
Teach your grandam to spin.
Teach your grandame to suck eggs.
Teach your tongue to say, "I do not know."
Teach your tongue to say, 'i don't know,' rather than invent something.
Teach your tongue to say: "I do not know."
Ten measures of beauty descended on the world; nine went to jerusalem, and one to the rest of the world.
That's how the world is: wolves kill sheep.
The air of the land of israel makes one wise.
He who follows advice from women will end up in hell.
He who gives charity anonymously is greater than moses.
He who gossips and he who listens to it deserve to be thrown to the dogs.
He who instigates good deeds is greater than the one who performs them.
He who is his own judge never finds a reason to condemn.
He who is unyielding in a dispute is a sinner.
He who prays for his neighbors will be heard for himself.
He who takes his rank lightly raises his own dignity.
Honor is greater than wealth; wealth is only an instrument to attain honor.
Hope for a miracle, but don't rely on it.
When the wife is away, the husband is master of the house.
When the wise man gets angry, he stops being wise.
When two friends part they have to lock up each other's secrets and throw away the key.
When two men quarrel, the one who yields first displays the nobler character.
When you have no choice, mobilize the spirit of courage.
When you're in a strange city, adopt its manners.
Where there is no wine, we need medicine.
Which is a man's most desirable occupation? the one for which he is most fit.
Who can find a woman of valor? her price is far above rubies.
Who is mighty? One who makes an enemy into a friend.
The beginning of sin is sweet; its end is bitter.
The best doctor is to be found in hell.
The best way to find happiness is not to search for it.
The book and the sword descended from heaven together.
The city, whose physician has the gout, is in a bad state.
The community is israel's rampart.
The costliest clock can show only sixty minutes in every hour.
The court is most merciful when the accused is most rich.
The cure for anxiety about the future is not nostalgia for the past.
The day is short and work lasts a long time.
There is nothing better than a good reputation.
There is one moral duty that moralists underrate almost criminally - the duty to enjoy god's world.
There's no rain without thunder, and no children born without pain.
These three are the marks of a Jew--a tender heart, self-respect, and charity.
Those who train themselves in wisdom cultivate true courage.
Three need to be guarded: a patient, a groom, and a bride.
Three rebel against the light: the thief, the adulterer, and the bat.
Three things are good in small doses and bad in big ones: yeast, salt, and hesitation.
Three things have a flavor of the world to come: sabbath, the sun, and married love.
Three things please a man: a lovely home, a lovely wife, and lovely possessions.
Knowledge is like the sun - it dispels the darkness.
Laziness likes to justify itself for not doing anything because it cannot do everything.
Leadership shortens life.
Look after me, and i'll look after you.
Love and hate always exaggerate.
Love blinds the eyes to faults, and hatred blinds the eyes to virtues.
Love does not pay attention to dignity.
Love forgets dignity.
Love him who tells you your faults in private.
Make not a fence more expensive or more important than the thing that is fenced.
It is better to talk to a woman and think of God, than talk to God and think of a woman.
It is fitting for a great God to forgive great sinners.
It's better that you suffer an injustice than you commit one.
It's not the sin that maddens a person but the desire to do it.
Join the community: the wolf snatches only the stray sheep that wanders off from the flock.
Judge a man not by the words of his mother, but from the comments of his neighbors.
Judgment delayed is judgment avoided.
Just as people's faces are different, so are their opinions different.
Just as the world cannot exist without livelihoods, so it cannot exist without miracles and wonders.
Kindness is the beginning and the end of the law.
The more you add, the worse it gets.
The needle, small and thin, can support a man and his family.
The place honors not the man; it is the man who honors the place.
The punishment of a liar is that he is never believed, even when he speaks the truth.
The rabbi is just the man who knows the torah - he is not the torah itself.
The sleep of the wicked people is a benefit for them and a boon to the world.
The sun will set without thy assistance.
The thief who has no opportunity to steal thinks he is an honest man.
The torah can be interpreted in different ways. god told moses, 'decide according to the majority.'
The truth is a heavy burden that few care to carry.
Whoever pursues fame and greatness, they flee from him; whoever shuns greatness, it comes after him.
Whoever teaches his son teaches not only his son but also his son's son, and so on to the end of generations.
Whoever welcomes his friend with a smile, it's as though he gave his friend the finest gifts in the world.
Whom god favors, he tries with affliction.
Wine renews the passion of lovers, and the hatred of enemies.
Wine tops the list of all medicines.
Wisdom without morality is like a ring without a gem.
With a good son-in-law you gain a son, with a bad one you lose your daughter, too.
Women don't know what a secret is.
You don't show a fool a job half done.
There are all kinds of people in the world: asses and mules, dogs and hogs, and also worms.
There are no bad beasts except man.
There are people who deserve paradise for their thoughts, and hell for their deeds.
There are seventy ways of interpreting the bible.
There are three crowns: bible, priesthood, royalty. but the crown of a good name surpasses them all.
There are three people whose lives are unworthy - the overly compassionate, the hot-tempered, and the hypercritical.
There are three things that attract: a house for its inhabitants, a woman for her spouse, and a bargain for a customer.
There is no greater beauty than that of logic.
There is no such thing as tasty medicine.
There is no vice that does not occasionally have some benefit, and no virtue that at times is not hurtful to some people.
Science without religion is lame; religion without science is blind.
Silence heals all ills.
Silence is a fence around wisdom.
Silence is a fine jewel for a woman, but it is little worn.
Silence is a woman's best garment.
Since god could not be everywhere, he created mothers.
Slander is more deadly than weapons; weapons wound from close range, slander hurts from a distance.
Slander slays three persons: the speaker, the spoken to, and the spoken of.
Small children, a headache; big children, heartache.
Sometimes the position does not make the man, but the man makes the position.
A jew without a wife will not find peace in this life.
A leader is not necessarily one who knows the way but one who thinks he knows the way.
A liar's punishment: even when he tells the truth, people don't believe him.
A little fire burns up a great deal of corn.
A man dies when he stops working.
A man without a woman cannot defend himself against seductions.
A man's heart tells him of his opportunities better than seven watchmen on the lookout tower.
A man's intelligence is located in the tip of the pen.
A pain that pricks the conscience is more effective than a lot of whiplashes.
A people's legends reveal its character more clearly than its acts and events.
Choose an easy death for one who must be executed.
Clean bodies, pure morals.
Courage is a kingdom without a crown.
Customs are stronger than laws.
Do not eat before you have fed your animal.
Do not judge your fellow man until you have stood in his place.
Do not speak of secret matters in a field that is full of little hills.
Do not speak of secrets in a field that is full of little hills.
Don't be quick to get angry; rage is found in the bosom of fools.
Three things show a man's character: his drinking, his pocket, and his anger.
Through faith man experiences the meaning of the world; through action he is to give it meaning.
Till age forty it is better to eat. after that, drinking is better.
Till age six, your son is your master; until ten he's your servant; until sixteen, a wonderful adviser; from then on, he's either your friend or your enemy.
Time heals old pain, while it creates new ones.
Time is a great healer.
To be simple is a pedestrian virtue, but to persevere in simplicity is a virtue of spiritual giants.
To do things wrong with best intentions is better than acting to the letter of the law with evil intentions.
To punish a student, use a shoe lace.
To save one man is like saving the world.
Don't be sweet lest people lick you.
Don't be too sweet lest you be eaten up; don't be too bitter lest you be spewed out.
Don't live in a town where there are no doctors.
Don't put your trust in princes, or the sons of men; there is no salvation in them.
Don't visit auctions if you have no money.
Earning a living is as hard as splitting the red sea.
Eat vegetables and fear no creditors, rather than eat duck and hide.
Equality of man is an empty phrase so long as it does not exist among the world's peoples.
Even if a fool remains silent, he is considered wise.
Even when a sharp sword rests on your neck, don't give up on mercy.
If I am not to myself, who will be? And when I am to myself, who am I? And if not now, when?
The hat burns on the head of the thief.
You don't always miss the bus. Sometimes, it misses you.
Borrowing is the mothero of trouble
The road to Eden [Heaven] is difficult, but the ways to Tophet [Hell] are easy.
Dont be too sweet, or else youll be eaten up; dont be too bitter, or else youll be spitted out.
Dont trust someone who tells you all of his troubles and keeps you from all of his joys.
There is no book that contains absolutely nothing bad, and there is no book that contains absolutely nothing good.
A defendants confession is worth a hundred witnesses.
A good son-in-law is like the acquisition of a new son; a bad one is like the loss of your daughter.
Dont live in a town where there are no doctors.
Whoever depends on his wifes earnings will not succeed.
When two friends part they have to lock up each others secrets and throw away the key.
Teach thy tongue to say, "I do not know".
Marry for money, my little sonny, a rich mans joke is always funny.
The kind man feeds his beast before sitting down to dinner.
Teach thy tongue to say, "I do not know ".
Dont visit auctions if you have no money.
He is not a full man who does not own a piece of land.
Grapes picked too early dont even make good vinegar.
Dont be too sweet lest you be eaten up; dont be too bitter lest you be spewed out.
An advantage of poverty, your relatives gain nothing by your death.
When two men quarrel, the one who yields first displays the nobler character.
No marriage contract is made without a quarrel.
Repentance prolongs a mans life.
Your health comes first  you can always hang yourself later.
